name: Dandelion - Core Product Platform
description: The Ruby on Rails backend application that powers app.salsify.com. This is the primary monolith service containing the core PIM functionality, user authentication, GraphQL APIs, and administrative tooling. Uses continuous deployment (CD) where commits on master are automatically deployed to production.

name: Advance ARR - Advanced Channel Mapping Experience
description: An enhanced user interface and set of GraphQL APIs for target schema channel mapping. Part of the 'Expressivity' initiative to improve the user mapping experience by making the UI more expressive. Includes support for complex nested structures like ArrayMappingEntry and StructMappingEntry for mapping product data to retailer-specific formats.

name: Target Schema - Channel Data Structure Definition
description: A structured definition of the data format required by a specific retail channel. Contains TargetSchemaFields (individual data points), TargetSchemaFieldGroups (logical groupings of fields), and supports nested structures. Used in channel mapping to transform Salsify product data into retailer-specific formats.

name: Target Schema Mapping - Channel Field Mapping Configuration
description: The configuration that maps Salsify product attributes to target schema fields for a specific channel. Contains mapping entries that can be formulas, direct property mappings, or complex nested structures (ArrayMappingEntry, StructMappingEntry). Supports analysis-based filtering and grouping.

name: Expressivity - Enhanced Mapping UI Initiative
description: A product initiative to improve the channel mapping user experience by making the UI more expressive and capable of handling complex nested data structures. Introduced new data models for exploded mapping and analysis, GraphQL APIs, and querying/filtering capabilities.

name: Superuser Permissions DSL
description: A domain-specific language (DSL) in Dandelion for defining and managing superuser (admin) permissions. Follows attribute-based access control (ABAC) patterns with policies, statements, and conditions. Supports organization-scoped and resource-scoped authorization, with automatic GraphQL API generation for authorization checks.

name: Policy Evaluator - Superuser Authorization Engine
description: The authorization engine in Dandelion that evaluates superuser permissions. Provides dynamically generated methods like `manage_foo_authorized?` based on statements defined in the SuperuserPermissions DSL. Handles both organization-scoped and resource-scoped authorization checks.

name: Evaluation Suite - LLM Evaluation Framework
description: A separate Salsify repository providing tooling for running evaluations of LLM (Large Language Model) use-cases. Dandelion integrates with this suite to evaluate AI-powered features. Based on the Azure Evaluation SDK.

name: Infrastructure Management Platform
description: Internal Salsify platform for managing service infrastructure. Provides visibility into service deployments across staging and production environments. Accessible at infra-mgmt.ops.salsify.com.
